Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of San Diego
Notes: Case was settled after the California Supreme Court partially denied the company's challenge to the class certification: https://scocal.stanford.edu/opinion/brinker-restaurant-corp-v-super-ct-34063

Private Litigation Case Title: Abla v. Brinker Restaurant Corporation et al

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division

Description: The California Attorney General announced the settlement of an environmental lawsuit against major restaurant chains under which hundreds of restaurants statewide will be required to post warnings for patrons about mercury in fish. The defendants also agreed to pay civil penalties and fund a consumer education program.

Company: Brinker Restaurant Corporation d/b/a Chili's Grill & Bar
Brinker International Payroll Company, LP d/b/a Maggiano's Little Italy
